intro: Solenanthus rumicifolius, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Solenanthus rumicifolius is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
